Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding inadequate state protection and lack of well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' fear of persecution found not credible
Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA relating to well-founded fear and state protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution and lack of state protection in Hungary and Mongolia
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to report incidents to authorities; insufficient evidence to rebut presumption of state protection
Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing followed by judicial review
Application_Error: Failure to prove inadequate state protection or well-founded fear
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution, adequacy of state protection
Application_Factor: Lack of reporting to authorities, credibility gaps
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Refugee Eligibility Provisions
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of persecution and lack of state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration, failure to report incidents
Procedural_Fairness: No indication of procedural unfairness raised
Credibility_Issues: Applicants' testimony lacked credibility regarding fear of persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's assessment of state protection and fear of persecution
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review
Omission_Type: Failure to report incidents to home country authorities
